org.prebake.service.tools
Interface InVmProcess

All Known Implementing Classes:
CpProcess, JarProcess
public interface InVmProcess

A virtual "process" that can be used to implement trivial command line tools in the VM.

InVmProcesses are part of the TCB so implementers are responsible for maintaining the following invariants:

  • Do not muck with any files in the client root. TODO: Maybe pass a signal to relax this in the case where the success of this process completely determines the success of the product.
  • Do not cause any side effects after the run method completes whether normally or abnormally. Specifically, the run method might be interrupted at any time by a CancellationException, InterruptedException or due to resource exhaustion.
  • Do not access state owned by other threads.
  • Do not access the file system except through the file system object reachable from the cwd parameter to run(java.nio.file.Path, java.lang.String...).
  • Release all resources acquired.
